summary: This document is an email chain from October 4, 2019, regarding logistics for attorney briefings about the Epstein case. The FBI Victim Services Division is requesting personal and security information from attorneys planning to attend briefings scheduled for October 15 and 23, 2019, to be held in a federal building. The emails coordinate the collection of RSVP details, including which victims the attorneys represent.

events.title: Epstein Case Attorney Briefing
events.description: A briefing for attorneys representing victims in the Epstein case, scheduled to be held at 10:00 AM in a federal building.

events.title: Epstein Case Attorney Briefing
events.description: A second briefing for attorneys representing victims in the Epstein case, scheduled to be held at 10:00 AM.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was organizing briefings for attorneys representing victims in the Epstein case in October 2019.
Two briefings were scheduled: October 15, 2019, and October 23, 2019, both at 10:00 AM in a federal building.
Attorneys were required to provide detailed personal and security information, including Social Security Number and citizenship, to attend.
The correspondence shows ongoing case management and victim support efforts after Epstein's death in August 2019.
The emails indicate coordination between FBI personnel and attorneys to facilitate these legal briefings.
